name: Avoid using hardcoded seed or no seed at all for random values generation
description:
Functions that generate random or pseudorandom values, which are passed a seed, should not be called with a constant argument. If a pseudorandom number generator (such as CL_ABAP_RANDOM class or its variants) is seeded with a specific constant value, the values returned by GET_NEXT, INT and similar methods which return or assign values are predictable for an attacker that can collect a number of PRNG outputs.

If no seed is provided at all, the generation is also not random.

Classes used to generate random /pseudorandom numbers:

CL_ABAP_RANDOM
CL_ABAP_RANDOM_DECFLOAT16
CL_ABAP_RANDOM_DECFLOAT34
CL_ABAP_RANDOM_FLOAT
CL_ABAP_RANDOM_INT
CL_ABAP_RANDOM_PACKED
CL_ABAP_RANDOM_PACKED_DEC1
CL_ABAP_RANDOM_PACKED_DEC2
CL_ABAP_RANDOM_PACKED_DEC3
CL_ABAP_RANDOM_PACKED_DEC4
CL_ABAP_RANDOM_PACKED_DEC5
CL_ABAP_RANDOM_PACKED_DEC6
CL_ABAP_RANDOM_PACKED_DEC7
CL_ABAP_RANDOM_PACKED_DEC8
CL_ABAP_RANDOM_PACKED_DEC9
CL_ABAP_RANDOM_PACKED_DEC10
CL_ABAP_RANDOM_PACKED_DEC11
CL_ABAP_RANDOM_PACKED_DEC12
CL_ABAP_RANDOM_PACKED_DEC13
CL_ABAP_RANDOM_PACKED_DEC14
output:
Associated to each violation, the following information is provided:
- The number of violation occurrences
- Bookmarks for violation occurrences found in the source code
rationale: If an attacker can guess (or knows) the seed, then the attacker may be able to determine the random numbers that will be produced from the PRNG.
remediation:
Functions that generate random or pseudorandom values must provide a seed argument which is not constant.
Example:
  GET TIME STAMP FIELD l_now.
  g_seed = FRAC( l_now ) * 10000.
  gcl_prng = cl_abap_random=>create( seed = g_seed ).
sample:
In this sample : the values produced by the object r are predictable from the object s.

DATA: s TYPE REF TO cl_abap_random,
  r TYPE REF TO cl_abap_random,
  var1 TYPE i,
  var2 TYPE i.

s = cl_abap_random=>create( seed = 12 ).

DO 10 TIMES.
  CALL METHOD s->int RECEIVING value = var1.
  WRITE:/ var1.
ENDDO.

r = cl_abap_random=>create( seed = 12 ).

DO 10 TIMES.
  CALL METHOD r->int RECEIVING value = var2.
  WRITE:/ var2.
ENDDO.

In this example, pseudorandom number generators: r and s were identically seeded, so var1 = var2
--------------------------
Same thing with this code:

DATA: s TYPE REF TO cl_abap_random,
  r TYPE REF TO cl_abap_random,
  var1 TYPE i,
  var2 TYPE i.

s = cl_abap_random=>create(  ).

DO 10 TIMES.
  CALL METHOD s->int RECEIVING value = var1.
  WRITE:/ var1.
ENDDO.

r = cl_abap_random=>create(  ).

DO 10 TIMES.
  CALL METHOD r->int RECEIVING value = var2.
  WRITE:/ var2.
ENDDO.
